body_html:
I ran into this issue when building tensorflow 1.4.1 using a toolchain which targets glibc 2.11.3.

I was able to fix this by adding #include <time.h> before the #include <fcntl.h> line in the BoringSSL src/crypto/bio/socket_helper.c file.

From this bug report it sounds as if this may effect other glibc versions.
body_text:
I ran into this issue when building tensorflow 1.4.1 using a toolchain which targets glibc 2.11.3.
I was able to fix this by adding #include <time.h> before the #include <fcntl.h> line in the BoringSSL src/crypto/bio/socket_helper.c file.
From this bug report it sounds as if this may effect other glibc versions.
body:
I ran into this issue when building tensorflow 1.4.1 using a toolchain which targets glibc 2.11.3.

I was able to fix this by adding `#include <time.h>` before the `#include <fcntl.h>` line in the BoringSSL src/crypto/bio/socket_helper.c file.  

From [this bug report](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21371) it sounds as if this may effect other glibc versions.
